item.title: Covid: More than 500,000 app pings in a single week
item.description: Alerts asking people in England and Wales to isolate for 10 days are causing concern among businesses.

item.title: Afghanistan: Reporting streets away from the Taliban in Kunduz province
item.description: The BBC's Yogita Limaye travels to Afghanistan's Kunduz province, most of which has fallen to the Taliban.

item.title: Bukayo Saka 'knew instantly of hate' he would receive after England defeat
item.description: England's Bukayo Saka said he "knew instantly the kind of hate" he was going to receive after his miss in the penalty shootout in the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: Covid-19: 500,000 app pings in a week and supermarkets to encourage mask wearing
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Thursday evening.

item.title: Covid patient’s own blood cells could treat lung scarring
item.description: A therapy made from a patient’s white blood cells is being trialled by doctors in London.

item.title: Blue Origin: Teenager to fly into space with Jeff Bezos
item.description: Oliver Daemen, 18, will become the youngest person to fly to space with the Blue Origin venture.

item.title: Levelling up: Boris Johnson promises more powers for local leaders
item.description: Boris Johnson promises more power for local leaders, but Labour says his speech was "gibberish".

item.title: Homes raided in inquiry into Matt Hancock CCTV leak
item.description: Investigators want to know who obtained images of the ex-minister kissing an aide in his office.

item.title: WhatsApp to let users message without their phones
item.description: For the first time, billions of people will be able to use the service even if their phone has no battery.

item.title: Lisa Shaw death: Husband calls for vaccine choice
item.description: Lisa Shaw's widower wants people to have the choice of which Covid-19 vaccine they get.

item.title: Andy 'The Viking' Fordham: Former BDO world darts champion dies aged 59
item.description: Former BDO world champion Andy 'The Viking' Fordham dies aged 59.

item.title: Ruth Madeley: Actress says taxi driver took her wheelchair away
item.description: The Bafta-nominated Ruth Madeley says the driver also refused to take her to an accessible entrance.

item.title: Germany floods: Collapsed buildings and submerged cars
item.description: Heavy rain has caused flooding in western Germany, leading to collapsed buildings and submerged cars.

item.title: Cheshunt: Police hurt before stolen car driven along railway line
item.description: Video footage shows what one eyewitness described as "like a scene from Grand Theft Auto".

item.title: Face masks: Will people living in a low Covid area still wear them?
item.description: Will people who live in an area that has one of England's lowest Covid rates continue to wear masks?

item.title: Sixth-form students use art to explore fake news
item.description: Sixth-formers from 58 colleges show their creative work in an online exhibition.

item.title: Government purchase of wine increases by £26,000
item.description: The "self-funding" collection of fine wines was topped up during the pandemic, figures reveal.

item.title: Clippy returns - as an emoji
item.description: Microsoft changes its paperclip emoji to look like its early virtual assistant, the object of much affection and frustration.

item.title: Menopause: Swansea MP calls for change on 'the change'
item.description: Campaigners want women to talk about the menopause and call for more training for GPs.

item.title: Czech women seek compensation for coerced sterilisations
item.description: Thousands of women were sterilised without their consent in former Czechoslovakia in the 1970s and 1980s.

item.title: Covid: Isolating children miss the last week of primary school
item.description: This Cheshire school's end-of-year play has gone ahead despite a child testing positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Covid: Bereaved Carmarthenshire survivor questions lockdown easing
item.description: Gwyn Tovey's wife Rita died just weeks after he caught the virus, which led to Long Covid.

item.title: The Papers: 'Mask chaos' and UK set to 'sizzle' in heatwave
item.description: Thursday's papers lead on everything from Covid and face coverings to healthy eating and heatwaves.

item.title: South Africa mother: Why I threw baby to strangers
item.description: The building was allegedly set on fire by looters amid an eruption of riots across South Africa.

item.title: PMQs: What did Boris Johnson say about the booing of England players?
item.description: Labour challenged the prime minister over his position on those who booed England when they "took the knee".

item.title: 'My husband was an angel - then he raped me'
item.description: Marital rape has long been a taboo issue in Egypt, but now victims are beginning to speak out.

item.title: Should we trust big tech with our health data?
item.description: Our medical records are in demand by tech firms who want to use the data to help tackle illnesses.

item.title: Olympic Games: 'Gang life nearly killed me - sprinting was my way out'
item.description: As Darren Campbell emerged as a talented teenage sprinter, he was leading a double life as a gang member. A twist of fate broke him free.

item.title: Covid: What will mask makers do now?
item.description: People around the country have made and sold masks during the pandemic. Here's what they'll do next.

item.title: Why black TikTok creators have gone on strike
item.description: Backlash for "cultural appropriation" on the video-making app may mean no viral dances for a while.

item.title: McGregor 'had multiple stress fractures in shin' going into Poirier fight
item.description: Conor McGregor says he was already injured before suffering a broken leg in the fight with Dustin Poirier in Las Vegas at UFC 264.

item.title: Fury v Wilder III: Rescheduled fight confirmed for 9 October
item.description: Tyson Fury's third world heavyweight title fight against Deontay Wilder is rescheduled for 9 October.

item.title: Tour de France: Tadej Pogacar holds on to yellow after stage 18 win
item.description: Slovenia's Tadej Pogacar claims back-to-back Tour de France stage wins to underline his dominance in the leader's yellow jersey.

item.title: British Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton admits it will be 'tall order' to win 2021 title
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says winning an eighth Formula 1 world drivers' title this year will be a "tall order".

item.title: The Open 2021: Brandt Snedeker almost gets a hole-in-one at the 16th and then hits an eagle on 17th
item.description: American Brandt Snedeker almost gets a hole-in-one on the 16th at The Open and then hits an eagle on the next hole at Royal St George's.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Max Whitlock v Liv Cooke in balance, speed & skill test - who wins?
item.description: Olympic and world champion gymnast Max Whitlock takes on football freestyle world champion Liv Cooke in our Olympian versus series.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing when restrictions end on 19 July?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules take effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Fully jabbed adults in Scotland, England and Wales won't have to quarantine on return from amber-list countries from 19 July.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: What are the rules for pubs, restaurants, festivals and gigs?
item.description: Near-normal service should resume in pubs and restaurants in England and Scotland from 19 July.

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: 'Indians don't talk about sex - so I help them'
item.description: An Indian sex coach says parents turn to her for advice as sex education is not available in schools.

item.title: Ghana's Kojo Marfo: Sell-out show for butcher-turned-painter
item.description: He's got rock star fans and two sold-out shows to his name, but Kojo Marfo prefers life's simple joys.

item.title: Fire lookouts: The US Forest Service lookouts watching for fires
item.description: In remote towers, US Forest Service lookouts act as an early warning system for forest fires.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: Bibaa and Nicole: The life after death of two sisters
item.description: Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman died in a senseless attack. But they should not be remembered as victims.
